step.info: Each time it starts, docker selects an IPv4 subnet for its virtual Ethernet bridge. The selection can change; this step ensures consistency.

substep.cmd: Identify the IPv4 subnet and netmask docker has selected for its virtual Ethernet bridge.

stepxmp.codeblock: ip addr show docker0 | grep inet

substep.cmd: Add the following flags to the end of the OPTIONS declaration.

stepxmp.p: Replace Bridge-Subnet with the IPv4 subnet docker selected for its virtual bridge:

substep.info: For example, if the bridge subnet is 172.17.0.1, add the following flags: --dns=172.17.0.1 --bip=172.17.0.1/16

info.note: Use a space character ( ) to separate flags, and make sure the double quote character (") delimits the declaration of OPTIONS.

step.cmd: Update the Linux kernel, if necessary.

substep.cmd: Determine which kernel version is installed.
substep.stepresult: If the result is lower than 3.10.0-327.22.2.el7.x86_64, perform the following substep.

substep.cmd: Update the kernel or the operating system and then restart the host.
substep.info: The following commands require internet access or a local mirror of operating system packages.
substep.stepxmp: Update only the kernel: yum makecache fast && yum update -y kernel && reboot
Update the operating system, including the kernel: yum makecache fast && yum update -y && reboot

step.cmd: Create a systemd override file for the Docker service definition.

stepxmp.codeblock: cat <<EOF > /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/docker.conf [Service] TimeoutSec=300 EnvironmentFile=-/etc/sysconfig/docker ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker daemon \$OPTIONS -H fd:// EOF

Open /etc/default/serviced with a text editor, and then customize the same variables that were customized in the pre-upgrade configuration file.
